title: Voice of the Mirror: It's time for us to ditch this lame-duck Prime Minister
text:

Boris Johnson may believe he is leading us into a Brexit general election.

But elections are rarely about what those contesting them might choose.

For this will be an opportunity for the nation to vote not just on Brexit but on a decade of Tory austerity and unnecessary hardship, of inequality and on a lame-duck Prime Minister.

And going to the polls in winter, when our NHS is already buckling under the strain, may mean the real issues of this country quickly rise up the agenda.

Yet even if we look at the election on Johnson’s narrow terms, he enters the contest as a dud – the Tory PM who vowed to deliver Brexit by October 31, and failed.

(Image: Peter Summers)

So he deserves to disappear into his ­infamous ditch.

December 12 now offers a glorious opportunity to boot jaundiced Johnson and his austerity Tories out of high office and put Jeremy Corbyn in to No 10.

Above all else, this is a chance to vote for positive change over the next five years, to vote for a £10 minimum wage, decent public serv-

ices and everything else in Labour’s transformative programme.

Cocky Johnson may lead in the polls but he should recall the wise warning from past Tory premier Harold Macmillan about fearing “events”, and Labour’s Harold Wilson’s observation that a week is a long time in politics.

(Image: REUTERS)

As Theresa May discovered to her party’s cost, opinion poll leads much larger than Johnson’s have counted for next to nothing in the red-hot heat of battle.

So the Brendas from Bristol who didn’t

want a December election can take their revenge on Johnson – while simultaneously voting for a better Britain.

Full of Pride

OUR inspiring Daily Mirror Pride of Britain winners taking over Downing Street

was the very best of the country at the heart of power.

And who knows, this time next year there might be a fresh Prime Minister in No10 to meet and greet 2020’s winners – winners who will again make Britain great.
